Description: Shell, often referred to as a shell script, is a scripting language used for command-line interaction with an operating system. It facilitates the automation of repetitive tasks, execution of system commands, and the creation of custom workflows in a Unix-like environment.

TypeScript is a statically typed superset of JavaScript designed for large-scale application development. It introduces static typing, interfaces, and other features to enhance code quality and maintainability, making it particularly useful for building robust and scalable web applications.

PHP is a server-side scripting language primarily used for web development to create dynamic and interactive web pages. It is embedded in HTML code and enables the execution of server-side tasks, making it widely employed for building dynamic websites and web applications.

Go, often referred to as Golang, is a statically typed and compiled programming language designed for simplicity, efficiency, and scalability. Developed by Google, it is commonly used for building system-level software, distributed systems, and web servers, known for its strong concurrency support and efficient performance.

JavaScript is a versatile, high-level scripting language primarily used for web development to make web pages interactive and dynamic. It is commonly executed in web browsers but can also be employed on the server side, and with the advent of technologies like Node.js, JavaScript has expanded its usage to include server-side development as well.

C is a procedural, general-purpose programming language known for its efficiency and low-level programming capabilities. Widely used in system software, embedded systems, and application development, C has influenced many other programming languages and remains fundamental in the field of computer science.

Python is a high-level, interpreted programming language known for its readability and ease of use, emphasizing code readability and developer productivity. Widely used for web development, data analysis, artificial intelligence, and various applications, Python has become one of the most popular and versatile programming languages.

Java is an object-oriented, high-performance programming language known for its platform independence and versatility. Widely used for building enterprise-level applications, mobile apps (Android), and web development, Java's "write once, run anywhere" principle has contributed to its widespread adoption in various domains.

CSS is a style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document written in HTML or XML, including aspects like layout, colors, and fonts. It enables web designers to control the appearance and formatting of web pages, ensuring a consistent and visually appealing user experience across different devices and browsers.

Batch file scripting, often associated with Windows environments, involves creating scripts containing a series of commands executed in sequence. These scripts are used for automating repetitive tasks, managing system configurations, and simplifying routine operations on Windows operating systems.

Jupyter Notebook is an open-source interactive web application that allows users to create and share documents containing live code, equations, visualizations, and narrative text. It supports various programming languages, with Python being the most commonly used, and is widely employed for data analysis, machine learning, and collaborative research in scientific and academic domains.

HTML is a standard markup language used for creating and structuring the content of web pages. It defines the structure and layout of a web document by using tags and attributes, allowing browsers to interpret and display the content appropriately.

V is a compiled language, which means that it is translated into machine code before it can be run. V is similar to the Go programming language, and it can be used for a wide variety of applications, including web development, game development, and systems programming.

C++ is a high-performance, object-oriented programming language derived from C, known for its efficiency and flexibility. Widely used in systems programming, game development, and applications requiring high performance, C++ supports both procedural and object-oriented programming paradigms.

C# is a modern, object-oriented programming language developed by Microsoft. It is commonly used for building Windows applications, web applications through ASP.NET, and game development with the Unity game engine, and it is known for its strong integration with the .NET framework.

Clojure is a functional, Lisp-inspired programming language that runs on the Java Virtual Machine (JVM). It is designed for concurrent programming, emphasizing immutability and simplicity, and is often used for building scalable and resilient software systems.

Swift is a powerful and intuitive programming language developed by Apple for building iOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS applications. Known for its speed, safety features, and modern syntax, Swift has become the preferred language for Apple ecosystem development.

Objective-C is a general-purpose, object-oriented programming language that was traditionally used for developing macOS and iOS applications. While its usage has declined with the introduction of Swift, Objective-C remains relevant for maintaining and updating older Apple software projects.

Mustache is a logic-less template syntax used for creating dynamic content in web applications. It is often employed in various programming languages to separate the presentation layer from the business logic, promoting clean and modular code.

Nim is a statically-typed, compiled programming language that emphasizes efficiency, expressiveness, and readability. It is designed for systems programming, application development, and scripting, providing a balance between high-level features and low-level control.

Vue.js is a progressive JavaScript framework used for building user interfaces, particularly for single-page applications. It is known for its simplicity, flexibility, and reactivity, allowing developers to create interactive and dynamic web applications with ease.

Dart is a programming language developed by Google, known for its focus on simplicity, speed, and cross-platform development. Primarily used with the Flutter framework, Dart is employed for building mobile, web, and desktop applications with a strong emphasis on smooth user experiences.

Lua is a lightweight, dynamically-typed scripting language designed for embedded systems and game development. Known for its simplicity and flexibility, Lua is often used as a scripting language in various applications, including video games, embedded systems, and configuration files for larger programs.

Kotlin is a statically-typed programming language that runs on the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) and can also be compiled to JavaScript. It is designed to be concise, expressive, and interoperable with existing Java code, making it suitable for a wide range of applications, including Android app development, server-side development, and more.

SCSS is a preprocessor scripting language that is interpreted or compiled into CSS. It extends the capabilities of CSS by providing features like variables, nested rules, and mixins, making it easier to write and maintain stylesheets for web development.

Rust is a systems programming language focused on performance, memory safety, and zero-cost abstractions. It is designed to provide low-level control over hardware while preventing common programming errors, making it suitable for tasks like system-level programming, operating systems development, and building high-performance applications.

Assembly language is a low-level programming language that closely corresponds to machine code, with a one-to-one relationship between its instructions and the architecture's machine code instructions. It is used for programming at the level of the computer's central processing unit (CPU) and is often employed in tasks like system programming, embedded systems development, and reverse engineering.

Perl is a high-level, interpreted programming language known for its flexibility and powerful text-processing capabilities. It is commonly used for tasks such as web development, system administration, and automation scripting, especially when dealing with tasks involving text manipulation and regular expressions.

Dockerfile is a script used in Docker, a containerization platform, to define a set of instructions for building a Docker image. It specifies the base image, sets up the environment, installs dependencies, and configures the application, enabling consistent and reproducible container deployments across different environments.

Ruby is a dynamic, object-oriented programming language known for its simplicity and productivity. It is commonly used for web development, scripting, and automation, with frameworks like Ruby on Rails popular for building web applications.

Groovy is a dynamic, object-oriented programming language that runs on the Java Virtual Machine (JVM). It is often used as a scripting language for automating tasks, and it seamlessly integrates with Java, making it suitable for a wide range of applications, including web development and build automation.

Rich Text Format is a document file format developed by Microsoft that allows for the encoding of text formatting and graphics. It is commonly used for cross-platform document interchange and supports various formatting options, making it a versatile choice for sharing formatted documents between different word processors.

PowerShell is a task automation and configuration management framework from Microsoft, featuring a command-line shell and a scripting language. It is primarily used for system administration tasks, automation of repetitive tasks, and configuration management in Windows environments.

MATLAB is a high-level programming language and environment designed for numerical computing, visualization, and algorithm development. It is widely used in academia, engineering, and scientific research for tasks such as data analysis, mathematical modeling, and the implementation of complex algorithms.

Brainfuck is an esoteric programming language known for its minimalistic design and extreme simplicity. It uses a minimal set of commands to manipulate a memory tape and is often used for educational purposes or as a challenge for programming enthusiasts due to its intentionally difficult and concise syntax.

PlantUML is a textual-based modeling tool that uses a domain-specific language to describe and generate UML (Unified Modeling Language) diagrams. It simplifies the process of creating and maintaining UML diagrams by allowing developers and designers to express diagram specifications in a human-readable format, which is then automatically rendered into various diagram types, such as class diagrams or sequence diagrams.

Red is a programming language with a focus on simplicity and productivity, featuring a clean syntax and a highly expressive, homoiconic design. It is used for various purposes, including system-level programming, scripting, and GUI application development, providing a balance between low-level control and high-level abstractions.

DIGITAL Command Language (DCL) is a command-line scripting language associated with the VMS (Virtual Memory System) operating system developed by Digital Equipment Corporation (DEC, later acquired by Compaq, then HP). It is used for system management tasks, file manipulation, and interacting with the VMS operating system, providing a set of commands for controlling and customizing the system.

Erlang is a functional and concurrent programming language designed for building scalable, fault-tolerant systems with a focus on distributed and real-time applications. Developed by Ericsson, it is widely used in telecommunication infrastructure, messaging systems, and other applications where high concurrency, reliability, and fault tolerance are essential.

Vala is a programming language developed by GNOME for creating GObject-based APIs. It is designed to be a high-level language that simplifies the development of GNOME applications by providing modern features while compiling to efficient and low-level code.

Markdown is a lightweight markup language that uses plain text formatting syntax. It is commonly used for formatting and structuring documents, especially for creating documentation, readme files, and web content, as it allows users to easily write and read plain text that can be converted into HTML or other rich document formats.

OCaml is a functional programming language with a strong static type system and automatic memory management. It is utilized for a range of applications, including academic research, language development, and the construction of systems requiring both high performance and expressive, concise code.

Objective-C++ is an extension of the Objective-C language that allows for the integration of C++ code within Objective-C programs. It is often used in macOS and iOS development, providing developers with the flexibility to combine both Objective-C and C++ in projects, leveraging the strengths of both languages for specific tasks.

Haskell is a purely functional programming language known for its strong static typing and advanced type system. It is often used in academic and industrial settings for tasks such as mathematical modeling, theorem proving, and building robust and concise software with a focus on correctness and maintainability.

Cuda is a parallel computing platform and programming model developed by NVIDIA for leveraging the power of Graphics Processing Units (GPUs). It allows developers to use a C-like language to offload computation-intensive tasks to the GPU, enabling accelerated performance for tasks like scientific simulations, deep learning, and other parallel computing workloads.

Makefile is a configuration file used by the make build automation tool to specify a set of tasks and their dependencies for building a software project. It typically contains rules written in a domain-specific language that describe how source files should be compiled and linked to produce executable binaries or other desired outputs.

MATLAB is a high-level programming language and environment designed for numerical computing, visualization, and algorithm development. It is widely used in academia, engineering, and scientific research for tasks such as data analysis, mathematical modeling, and the implementation of complex algorithms.

Roff, short for "RunOFF," is a typesetting language used primarily for formatting documents, particularly on Unix and Unix-like systems. It is often associated with the troff typesetting system and is used for tasks such as formatting man pages and other system documentation.

TeX is a typesetting system designed by Donald Knuth for high-quality typesetting of complex documents. It is widely used in academia and publishing for the production of scientific and mathematical documents, as well as for the creation of books and articles with sophisticated formatting requirements.

CMake is a cross-platform build system that generates native build files and facilitates the build process for software projects. It uses its own scripting language (CMake language) to define build configurations and dependencies, making it easier for developers to manage and build their projects across different platforms.

Pascal is an imperative and procedural programming language designed for teaching structured programming and application development. While it has seen reduced popularity in recent years, it played a significant role in the education of programming fundamentals and was used for developing a variety of applications, including early versions of the Delphi integrated development environment.

CoffeeScript is a programming language that compiles to JavaScript, offering a more concise and readable syntax with features inspired by Ruby and Python. It is often used in web development to enhance the efficiency of writing and maintaining JavaScript code, providing developers with a higher-level abstraction while producing JavaScript that runs in web browsers.

BlitzBasic is a programming language designed for game development, known for its simplicity and ease of use. It provides a streamlined syntax and powerful graphics capabilities, making it well-suited for creating 2D and simple 3D games.

Less is a dynamic stylesheet language that extends CSS with features such as variables, nested rules, and functions. It simplifies and enhances the process of styling web pages, providing a more maintainable and flexible approach to writing cascading style sheets.

Common Lisp is a multi-paradigm programming language known for its flexibility and extensibility. It supports procedural, object-oriented, and functional programming, and is often used for artificial intelligence, symbolic computing, and rapid prototyping of software applications.

VBScript is a scripting language developed by Microsoft primarily for web development and automation tasks in the Windows environment. It is often used for client-side scripting in web browsers and for system administration tasks, leveraging the simplicity and integration with other Microsoft technologies.

NSIS is a scripting language used for creating Windows installers. It enables developers to create lightweight and customizable installation packages for software distribution on the Windows platform.

Julia is a high-level, high-performance programming language designed for technical computing, with a syntax that is familiar to users of other technical computing environments. It is often used for numerical and scientific computing, data analysis, machine learning, and other domains where performance and ease of development are crucial.

Scala is a statically typed programming language that combines object-oriented and functional programming paradigms. It is designed to be concise, elegant, and interoperable with Java, making it suitable for a wide range of applications, including web development, distributed systems, and data analysis.

Crystal is a statically-typed, compiled programming language that aims to provide a syntax similar to Ruby while delivering performance comparable to languages like C. It is used for developing high-performance, concurrent applications, emphasizing developer productivity and ease of use.

LiveScript, now known as "PureScript," is a functional programming language that compiles to JavaScript. It is designed to bring a more functional and expressive style to web development, providing features such as algebraic data types and pattern matching for building robust and maintainable web applications.

Jsonnet is a configuration language that allows you to describe JSON data in a more concise and expressive way, with features like variables, functions, and conditionals. It is commonly used for configuration management and defining complex data structures, providing a more flexible and readable alternative to traditional JSON.

R is a programming language and environment specifically designed for statistical computing and data analysis. Widely used in academia and industry, R provides a vast array of statistical and graphical techniques, making it a popular choice for tasks ranging from statistical modeling to data visualization.

AGS Script is a scripting language associated with Adventure Game Studio (AGS), a game development engine focused on creating point-and-click adventure games. AGS Script is primarily used for defining the behavior and interactions within these games, allowing developers to script puzzles, dialogues, and other game elements.

Adblock filter list is a set of rules written in a specific syntax, typically using the "Adblock Plus" or "uBlock Origin" syntax, to define which online elements (such as ads or tracking scripts) should be blocked from loading on a web page. These lists are used by ad-blocking browser extensions to enhance user experience by preventing unwanted content from displaying during online browsing.

AutoHotkey is a scripting language designed for automating the Windows GUI and general scripting tasks. It allows users to create custom scripts to automate repetitive tasks, remap keys, and create macros, enhancing productivity by automating various actions on a Windows computer.

Open Policy Agent is a policy-based control framework that provides a high-level declarative language to author and enforce policies across cloud-native environments. It is commonly used in the realm of DevOps and cloud security to define and enforce policies for access control, resource validation, and other governance aspects within modern, dynamic infrastructure.

Fennel is a programming language that is a Lisp variant designed to run on the Lua runtime. It combines Lisp's expressive and minimalist syntax with Lua's efficiency, making it suitable for embedding in applications and systems where Lua is utilized, with a focus on simplicity and extensibility.

Jinja is a templating engine for Python that allows the embedding of dynamic content within templates. It is commonly used in web development frameworks, such as Flask and Django, to generate dynamic HTML pages by integrating Python code into templates for rendering data dynamically.

Handlebars is a templating language that simplifies the generation of HTML by providing a concise syntax for embedding variables and expressions within templates. Primarily used in web development, it allows developers to create dynamic web pages by combining HTML structure with data-driven content in a clear and readable manner.

ActionScript is an object-oriented programming language primarily used for scripting interactive content within Adobe Flash applications. It enables developers to create dynamic and multimedia-rich web applications, games, and animations, but its usage has declined with the discontinuation of Adobe Flash in favor of more modern web technologies.

QML, or Qt Meta-Object Language, is a declarative language designed by the Qt framework for building user interfaces. It is used in conjunction with C++ in Qt applications to define the structure and behavior of graphical user interfaces, enabling developers to create visually appealing and interactive applications across various platforms.

Vim Script is a scripting language specifically designed for extending the functionality of the Vim text editor. It allows users to customize and automate tasks within Vim, from defining key mappings to creating complex plugins, enhancing the editor's capabilities according to individual preferences and needs.

Hack is a programming language developed by Facebook that is a static and gradually typed extension of PHP. It is primarily used for web development and allows developers to write code that combines the dynamic and flexible features of PHP with the added benefits of static typing for improved performance and maintainability.

Scheme is a minimalist, functional programming language that belongs to the Lisp family. Known for its simplicity and expressive power, Scheme is often used in education for teaching programming language concepts and in research for exploring language design and implementation.

ASP, or Active Server Pages, is not a programming language itself but rather a server-side scripting technology developed by Microsoft. It enables the creation of dynamic web pages by embedding scripts within HTML, often using languages like VBScript or JScript, to interact with databases and perform server-side tasks for web applications.

Solidity is a high-level programming language designed for developing smart contracts on blockchain platforms, notably the Ethereum blockchain. It is used to define the rules and behavior of decentralized applications (DApps) and automated agreements by executing code on the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM), facilitating the creation of secure and trustless transactions.

HCL, or HashiCorp Configuration Language, is a declarative language developed by HashiCorp for defining infrastructure as code (IaC). It is used to describe and configure the provisioning and orchestration of resources in tools such as Terraform, facilitating the creation and management of infrastructure across various cloud platforms.

F# is a functional-first programming language developed by Microsoft that runs on the .NET platform. Known for its strong support for functional programming paradigms, F# is used for a wide range of applications, including data analysis, scientific computing, and building scalable and maintainable software components within the .NET ecosystem.

Elixir is a functional and concurrent programming language built on the Erlang virtual machine (BEAM) known for its fault tolerance and scalability. Primarily used in developing distributed and fault-tolerant systems, Elixir is particularly well-suited for building robust and scalable web applications, real-time communication systems, and other distributed software solutions.

VHDL (VHSIC Hardware Description Language) is a hardware description language used for designing digital circuits and systems. It enables engineers to model and simulate the behavior of electronic systems, and it is commonly employed in the design and verification of complex integrated circuits, FPGA (Field-Programmable Gate Array) configurations, and other digital hardware.

Svelte a JavaScript framework designed for building user interfaces. It shifts the work traditionally done in the browser to a build step, resulting in smaller and more efficient runtime code, and is used for creating fast and reactive web applications with a focus on simplicity and performance.

Arduino refers to both a popular open-source electronics platform and the programming language used to develop software for it. The language is a simplified variant of C/C++, and Arduino is commonly used by hobbyists, students, and professionals to prototype and create a wide range of electronic projects, from simple gadgets to complex interactive systems.

GCC Machine Description refers to a component of the GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) that defines the instruction set and architecture-specific details for various processors. It is written in a specialized language and is crucial for enabling the GCC compiler to generate machine code optimized for specific hardware architectures during the compilation process.

ShaderLab is a domain-specific language used in Unity, a game development engine, to define shaders for rendering graphics and visual effects. It simplifies the process of creating and customizing shaders by providing a higher-level, artist-friendly syntax, and it is widely employed in game development to achieve specific visual styles and effects.

MDX, or Multidimensional Expressions, is a query language used for retrieving and analyzing data from multidimensional databases, particularly in the context of Microsoft SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS). It enables users to interact with and extract information from OLAP (Online Analytical Processing) cubes, making it a key tool for business intelligence and data analysis in data warehousing environments.

Eagle refers to a PCB (Printed Circuit Board) design software developed by Autodesk. It is used for designing and creating schematics and layouts for electronic circuits, making it a valuable tool in the field of electronics and electrical engineering.

ZenScript is a powerful scripting language designed for the CraftTweaker mod development platform in Minecraft. It allows users to modify and extend Minecraft gameplay through features like adding new recipes and creating custom mechanics.

Starlark is a domain-specific language designed for configuration files and build configuration, often used in projects like Bazel, a build and test tool developed by Google. It is simple, with a focus on readability, and allows developers to express build rules and configurations in a concise and maintainable way.

RAML, or RESTful API Modeling Language, is a YAML-based language for describing the structure of web APIs in a human-readable format. It is used to document and define RESTful APIs, facilitating communication and collaboration between developers, and is often employed in API design and development processes.

Smalltalk is an object-oriented, dynamically typed programming language known for its simplicity and interactive development environment. Originally designed for educational purposes, it has been influential in the development of graphical user interfaces and remains in use for various applications, including educational tools and niche software development projects.

Vim script is a scripting language used for customizing and extending the functionality of the Vim text editor. It allows users to create plugins, define key mappings, and automate tasks, enhancing the efficiency and personalization of the text editing experience in Vim.

q is a programming language specifically designed for handling and analyzing large datasets in financial environments, developed by Kx Systems. It excels in time-series data processing and is commonly used in finance and related industries for tasks such as algorithmic trading, risk management, and market analysis.

YARA is a pattern matching language used for writing custom rules to identify and classify malware or other threats in files or data streams. It is often employed in cybersecurity and digital forensics for creating signatures and rulesets to detect specific patterns associated with malicious software.

Logos is a domain-specific language used for writing custom compilers in the Apple ecosystem, primarily for iOS and macOS development. It enables developers to define syntax, semantic analysis, and code generation rules for creating specialized compilers that integrate seamlessly with Apple's Xcode development environment.

PL/SQL (Procedural Language/Structured Query Language) is a programming language designed for managing and manipulating relational databases in the Oracle Database management system. It is widely used for creating stored procedures, triggers, functions, and other database-centric operations, allowing developers to efficiently work with Oracle databases.

Visual Basic (VB) is an event-driven programming language developed by Microsoft. It is widely used for building Windows applications with graphical user interfaces and is known for its simplicity, making it accessible for beginners in software development.

Processing is both a programming language and an integrated development environment (IDE) designed for creative coding and visual arts projects. Built on top of Java, it simplifies complex programming concepts, making it accessible for artists and designers to create interactive and visual applications, simulations, and installations.

RouterOS Script refers to the scripting language used in MikroTik's RouterOS operating system, commonly employed in MikroTik routers and networking devices. It allows network administrators to automate various tasks, configure network settings, and implement custom functionalities within RouterOS, enhancing the efficiency of network management and customization.

EJS (Embedded JavaScript) is a templating language that allows JavaScript code to be embedded within HTML markup. It is often used in web development to dynamically generate HTML content on the server side, facilitating the creation of dynamic and data-driven web pages.

Coq is an interactive proof assistant and a formal language for specifying mathematical theories and reasoning about their correctness. It is primarily used in the field of formal verification for software and hardware systems, ensuring the correctness of mathematical proofs and aiding in the development of reliable and secure software.

SWIG (Simplified Wrapper and Interface Generator) is a tool that connects programs written in C and C++ with a variety of high-level programming languages, including Python, Java, and Ruby. It simplifies the process of creating language bindings, allowing developers to use functionalities from C and C++ in other languages, facilitating cross-language interoperability in software development.

AutoIt is a scripting language designed for automating the Windows GUI and general scripting tasks. It is often used for creating automation scripts, including automating repetitive tasks, GUI testing, and creating simple desktop applications on the Windows platform.

LLVM (Low Level Virtual Machine) is a compiler infrastructure that provides a collection of reusable compiler and toolchain components for various programming languages. It is widely used as the backend for many programming languages and enables the optimization, compilation, and execution of code for diverse platforms, fostering the development of efficient and performant software.

Visual Basic .NET (VB.NET) is an object-oriented programming language developed by Microsoft. It is used for building Windows applications, web applications, and web services, providing developers with a versatile tool for creating a wide range of software applications with a focus on ease of development and integration with the .NET Framework.

Flux is a functional and data-driven scripting language designed for querying, analyzing, and processing data in the context of time-series databases. It is notably used with InfluxDB, a time-series database, and allows users to express complex data transformations and analyses for monitoring and observability purposes.

Nix is a purely functional package manager and a domain-specific language for describing software build processes and configurations. It is designed for creating reproducible and declarative system environments, making it particularly useful for managing dependencies and ensuring consistent software builds across different platforms.

Cython is a programming language that makes it easy to write C extensions for Python. It allows developers to combine the ease of Python development with the performance benefits of compiled C code, making it useful for optimizing and speeding up certain parts of Python programs.

Zig is a statically typed programming language that focuses on performance, safety, and ease of use. It aims to provide low-level control similar to C and C++ while offering modern language features, making it suitable for systems programming, game development, and other performance-critical applications.

GDScript is a scripting language designed for use with the Godot game engine. It is dynamically typed and specifically tailored for game development, providing an easy-to-learn syntax and seamless integration with the Godot engine's functionality for building 2D and 3D games.

Apex is a strongly-typed, object-oriented programming language developed by Salesforce.com for building applications on the Salesforce platform. It is designed to facilitate the development of custom functionality within the Salesforce ecosystem, including triggers, controllers, and other server-side components for managing and automating business processes.

SQL (Structured Query Language) is a domain-specific language used for managing and manipulating relational databases. It is employed to query, update, and modify data in databases, providing a standardized way to interact with and retrieve information from structured data sets.

Mathematica is a symbolic computation system that uses a proprietary programming language called Wolfram Language. It is widely used for symbolic mathematics, data analysis, visualization, and general computation, providing a versatile platform for scientific and technical computing.

Bicep is a domain-specific language for defining and deploying Azure Resource Manager (ARM) templates. It is designed to simplify and enhance the authoring experience for Azure infrastructure as code, allowing users to express their infrastructure requirements more concisely and efficiently.

FreeBASIC is a high-level, open-source programming language that is based on the BASIC programming language with additional features. It is designed for creating Windows and console applications, focusing on ease of use and fast development, while also providing low-level access for more advanced programmers.

AL (Application Language) is a programming language used for developing extensions in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central, an enterprise resource planning (ERP) solution. It is designed for building customized business applications and automating processes within the Business Central environment, providing developers with the tools to tailor the ERP system to specific organizational needs.

Verilog is a hardware description language used to model and simulate digital circuits. It is primarily employed in the design and verification of electronic systems, enabling engineers to describe the behavior and structure of digital circuits before their physical implementation in hardware.

YAML is a human-readable data serialization format often used for configuration files and data exchange between languages with different data structures. It is commonly utilized in configuration files for applications, infrastructure as code (IaC), and other scenarios where human-friendly data representation is important.

Emacs Lisp, also known as Elisp, is a programming language specifically designed for extending and customizing the Emacs text editor. It serves as the scripting language for Emacs, allowing users to write custom functions, automate tasks, and modify the behavior of Emacs to suit their preferences.

Standard ML (SML) is a statically-typed functional programming language with a strong emphasis on type safety and expressiveness. It is commonly used in academic and research settings for teaching programming language concepts and for developing compiler and theorem proving tools.

MQL4 (MetaQuotes Language 4) is a programming language designed for developing custom trading algorithms (Expert Advisors) and technical indicators in the MetaTrader 4 trading platform. It is used by traders and developers to create automated trading strategies and analyze financial markets within the MetaTrader ecosystem.

OpenEdge ABL (Advanced Business Language) is a business application development language designed for building enterprise-level software solutions. It is commonly used in the Progress OpenEdge platform for developing robust and scalable business applications, with a focus on database interaction, application logic, and user interface development.

GLSL (OpenGL Shading Language) is a C-like language used for programming shaders, which are small programs executed on the GPU (Graphics Processing Unit) to control the rendering pipeline in graphics applications. It is commonly employed in graphics programming, particularly within the OpenGL and Vulkan frameworks, to create visual effects, shaders, and realistic rendering in computer graphics.

T-SQL (Transact-SQL) is a proprietary extension of SQL (Structured Query Language) used by Microsoft SQL Server and Sybase ASE databases. It is employed for querying, updating, and managing relational databases, allowing developers and database administrators to interact with and manipulate data in Microsoft's SQL Server ecosystem.

Smali is a low-level assembly-like language used for programming Android applications. It is primarily used for reverse engineering and modifying Android app bytecode, providing a way to inspect and modify the behavior of Android applications at the assembly level.

Astro is a modern JavaScript framework specifically designed for crafting static websites. It stands out for its speed, lightweight nature, and ease of use, employing a unique component-based approach to rendering web pages for enhanced performance.

ApacheConf typically refers to configuration files for the Apache HTTP Server, written in a syntax that defines how the server behaves. These configuration files, often named httpd.conf, are used to customize the behavior of the Apache web server, specifying settings such as virtual hosts, access control, and other server-related parameters.

ASL (AppleScript) is a scripting language developed by Apple for automating tasks and controlling applications on macOS. It allows users to create scripts to automate repetitive actions, manipulate files, and interact with various applications on the Mac platform.

Blade is a templating engine for the Laravel PHP framework, providing a syntax for embedding PHP code into views. It simplifies the process of creating dynamic and reusable web pages in Laravel applications, enhancing the separation of concerns between the application's logic and presentation layer.

Modelica is a declarative, equation-based modeling language used for describing the behavior of complex physical systems. It is commonly employed in the fields of engineering and physics for simulation and modeling of dynamic systems, enabling the representation of multidomain physical interactions in a modular and reusable manner.

SystemVerilog is a hardware description and verification language used in the design and verification of digital systems. It extends the capabilities of Verilog, providing features for design, simulation, and testbench development, making it a widely used language in the field of electronic design automation (EDA) for designing and verifying complex digital systems.

FreeMarker is a template engine written in Java that is used for generating dynamic content in various applications, especially web applications. It enables the separation of presentation logic from application logic by allowing developers to create templates that define the structure of the final output, which can be dynamically populated with data.

Smarty is a template engine for PHP, designed to simplify the separation of application logic and presentation in web development. It provides a template language that allows developers to embed logic and variables within HTML templates, facilitating the creation of dynamic and maintainable web pages.

Fortran, short for Formula Translation, is a procedural programming language primarily designed for scientific and engineering applications. It is widely used for numerical and scientific computing, especially in fields such as weather modeling, computational physics, and high-performance computing due to its efficiency in handling mathematical computations.

PL/pgSQL is a procedural programming language specifically designed for use with the PostgreSQL database management system. It enables the creation of stored procedures and functions within the database, facilitating complex data manipulation, business logic implementation, and enhancing the overall performance of database operations.

Nginx is a high-performance, open-source web server and reverse proxy server software. Written in C, it is designed to efficiently handle concurrent connections and serve as a front-end for various web applications, improving web server performance and scalability.

"M" typically refers to the programming language used in Power Query, a data connectivity and preparation tool from Microsoft. It is a functional language primarily used for transforming and cleaning data within the Power BI, Excel, and other Microsoft data-related applications.

VimL, short for Vimscript, is a scripting language specifically created for configuring and extending the Vim text editor. It is used to customize Vim's behavior, define key mappings, and create plugins to enhance the functionality of Vim for text editing and programming tasks.

NASL, or Nessus Attack Scripting Language, is a domain-specific scripting language used for writing security checks in the Nessus vulnerability scanner. It enables security professionals to define and execute custom vulnerability assessments, helping to identify and address security issues in networked systems and applications.

Macaulay2 is a computer algebra system designed for algebraic geometry and commutative algebra. It is written in C++ and provides a powerful environment for mathematical computations, particularly in areas related to algebraic geometry, polynomial computations, and commutative algebra research.

Twig is a template engine for the PHP programming language used for creating dynamic web content. It provides a syntax for embedding dynamic content in templates, facilitating the separation of logic and presentation in web applications.

Nextflow is a domain-specific language (DSL) and a workflow management system designed for the definition and execution of computational workflows, particularly in bioinformatics and scientific research. It simplifies the orchestration of complex and distributed processes, allowing researchers to define and execute data analysis pipelines efficiently.

XSLT, or Extensible Stylesheet Language Transformations, is a declarative, XML-based language used for transforming and styling XML documents. It enables the conversion of XML data into various formats and is commonly employed in web development and data integration to process and present structured information.

AppleScript is a scripting language developed by Apple for automating tasks and controlling applications on macOS. It allows users to write scripts to manipulate and interact with various system components, applications, and services, providing automation capabilities for tasks ranging from file management to complex workflows.

Valve Data Format (VDF) is a simple key-value pair data interchange format developed by Valve Corporation. It is commonly used in the video game industry for configuration files, data exchange between game components, and representing structured information in various Valve game-related contexts.

Puppet is an open-source configuration management tool that uses a declarative language to automate the provisioning and management of IT infrastructure. It is widely used for orchestrating the deployment and maintenance of software and system configurations across diverse computing environments.

Xtend is a statically-typed programming language designed to improve upon Java by providing concise syntax, enhanced features, and improved readability. It is often used in conjunction with Java and compiles to Java source code, offering developers a more expressive and streamlined language for building applications on the Java Virtual Machine (JVM).

OpenSCAD is a script-based, declarative 3D modeling language used for creating 3D models and designs. It allows users to describe objects through code, enabling parametric modeling and precise control over geometric shapes for 3D printing and computer-aided design (CAD) applications.

Ada is a high-level, statically-typed programming language designed for developing large and complex systems with a focus on safety and reliability. It is often used in critical systems such as aerospace, military, and healthcare applications where the emphasis is on producing robust and fault-tolerant software.

Haxe is a high-level, cross-platform programming language that can be transpiled into various target languages, including JavaScript, C++, and more. It is used for developing multi-platform applications, games, and interactive content, providing a versatile and efficient solution for code sharing across different platforms.

Groff, or the GNU Troff, is a typesetting system that processes plain text with markup commands to produce formatted documents. It is often used for creating various types of documents, including manuals, books, and technical reports, primarily in Unix and Unix-like operating systems.

Gherkin is a business-readable language for writing test scenarios in behavior-driven development (BDD), promoting collaboration between technical and non-technical stakeholders. It is commonly used with tools like Cucumber to describe and automate software behavior.

Racket is a versatile, multi-paradigm programming language used for teaching, domain-specific language development, and various applications. It supports functional, imperative, and object-oriented programming styles.

Ren'Py is a visual novel engine that utilizes its own scripting language for game development, specifically designed for creating interactive storytelling experiences. It simplifies the process of developing visual novels, allowing creators to focus on narrative design and character interactions.

Idris is a functional programming language with dependent types, allowing precise program specifications. It is employed for writing reliable software, especially in safety-critical applications and formal verification.

Robot Framework is an open-source test automation framework using a keyword-driven approach for BDD and ATDD. It simplifies test case definition with a tabular syntax and is commonly used for automating software testing.

Yacc, or Yet Another Compiler Compiler, is a tool for generating parsers that can process syntax according to a specified formal grammar. It is frequently used in compiler construction to implement syntax analysis for programming languages.
